content: Bitcoin may still be in a volatile market for a long time. How are you ready to dispose of your assets now? Would you like to buy and sell your assets/products/services for bitcoins? How are you ready to negotiate a price to make the deal go through?Let's discuss assets, goods and services which price is more than $200 net. Inexpensive goods have already been discussed on this forum. For now, we will not take into account the fact that the use of crypto may be prohibited in one country or another. Let's find how we are ready to negotiate, and what tools we do need in order the buyer could find the seller.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: Oilacris on June 13, 2022, 10:26:06 PMIf i dont have any choice or option then i might came up with this method but as much as possible i do lessen out such s pending.When the market price has a dip correction, I don't want to use my Bitcoin or even cash them out if there's an option of using fiat, I will.Bitcoin seems valuable stuff for me and also when you're disposing of them while the price was almost on the floor, I feel like missing the opportunity of making a profit and also burning the value of the dollar that's supposedly your profit.I prefer to hold when the price is in the correction stage, but I do the same, if there's no other option, I blindly sell them all without looking at the market price.  For now, buying Bitcoin little by little that the amount you can afford is the best option, when the Bitcoin price break the previous one that's the time I will add my assets to Bitcoin.

comments.author: niceli
comments.body: Honestly, I am more willing to have some assets before I can even consider selling anything for bitcoin. Unfortunately I do not have much, which resulted with me not really having anything to offer for crypto, and that is the reason why I am not trading at all. I would love to do it, bitcoin is the better version of owning assets, its both a currency and an asset at the same time. People often forget that even though there are 1+ trillion dollars worth of coins out there, there are plenty of poor people like me involved in crypto as well. I may not be the traditional poor person because I make a decent living, but I still do not have much, I just have income, not assets, not items in my house, I just have income that I spend everyone month. Downside of living in an expensive place.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Nothing has changed. Price goes up or low, there's not that much change on how I'll keep and spend my bitcoins. I've got the specific part for holding and it's just going to be added and not going to be spent. While on the other part of my portfolio, there's the part of being added and is willing to be spent. That's how I'm going to make things even if we're on a bear market, there's really not that much to change just because we're on a heavy blow by the bear now.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I'm selling everything for Bitcoin.  I'm selling typical Bitcoin themed silver coins: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1637562.0I'm selling other precious metals at spot price: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5072237.0I'm selling original silver coins that earn/store BTC: https://nastyfans.org/mintI'm even willing to sell my house for BTC if anyone is interested.  It's got a heated pool, an off-grid solar energy system, and lots of bedrooms (one with a separate electric circuit and exhaust tube for mining).Basically, there's no object in my life that wouldn't be traded for Bitcoin at the right price.  I'm ready to live that Jedi life over here.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: There's a certain local fiat for which I sell my BTC to deal with matters related to the country to which this fiat belongs. So I normally sell some for fiat, like, every month, to have some of that fiat on my card instead of doing international transfers. When the price feel to $30k, I thought it was way too low to sell, and now it's even lower, so I'm not sure what to do because it might get even lower and I'd really need to sell some at that point, which would be unwise. Bitcoin isn't much of an investment to me, but it's something I keep some of my money in. If I don't need fiat for something specific, I won't sell BTC, but that's largely true for my behavior with BTC regardless of the price situation. Reasonably, I think now is the time to hodl or, if you have extra funds, buy more.Of course, if I didn't have to sell and could, say, for the bills or for groceries in BTC, that would have been much easier.
